q: What causes corrosion on flood-barrier hardware?
a: Salt aerosols and dissimilar-metal contact create galvanic corrosion. Using 316 stainless hardware and nylon washers isolates metals and extends service life.
Rinse hardware monthly, apply marine anti-seize to bolts, and re-grease clamps yearly. Coat exposed fasteners with clear lanolin spray.

q: Can rusted bolts be cleaned or should they be replaced?
a: Light surface rust can be brushed off; deep pitting > 10 % diameter loss requires replacement. Document replacements in maintenance log.

q: Is galvanic corrosion covered by warranty?
a: Yes if all original components remain intact. Mixing carbon-steel anchors voids warranty per clause 7.2 of our maintenance guide.

q: What coating systems do you recommend?
a: Zinc-nickel electroplate for inland, duplex epoxy + polyurethane for coastal. Compatible with anchors on anchor-bolt requirements.
